article.headline: Pennsylvania 64, Columbia 50
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Jeff Schiffner had 12 points and was one of five Penn players in double figures as the Quakers defeated Columbia 64-50 Saturday night. Penn's 5-11 point guard, Charlie Copp, had a career-high 9 rebounds as the Quakers (15-9, 8-3 Ivy League) won for the eighth time in the last nine games. Dragutin Kravic had 11 points for Columbia (8-17, 4-8 Ivy League), which made only 19 of 53 shots, and was held to its lowest point total of the season. Columbia led 4-2, but after Schiffner and Mark Zoller hit consecutive three pointers, Penn never trailed again. A three-point shot by Kravic closed the gap to 26-20 with 4:12 left in the first half, but Tim Begley then scored nine points during a 13-3 run to give Penn a 39-23 edge at halftime. Penn took its biggest lead, 53-30, on two foul shots by Ibrahim Jaaber with 12:06 remaining, and Columbia never got closer than 14 points.
